arts.ttl: Why Joao Felix should be absolutely furious with Enzo Maresca following Chelsea's defeat to Ipswich - opinion
arts.sum: He shouldn't have been substituted first.

arts.ttl: Why Enzo Maresca went straight over to a furious Enzo Fernandez at the end of Ipswich vs Chelsea - journalist
Tuesday's Transfer Talk Update: Cole Palmer, Aaron Anselmino, Omar Marmoush
arts.sum: Sports Mole rounds up the latest confirmed transfer news and speculation from across the footballing world.

arts.ttl: Enzo Maresca insists Chelsea going ‘in right direction’ despite Ipswich shock
arts.sum: Maresca says side still ‘far from the best teams in England’ Kieran McKenna savours ‘special’ night after 2-0 victory As defeat at Ipswich completed a miserable Christmas, Enzo Maresca claimed his Chelsea team are still headed in the right direction but remain a work in progress. After Liam Delap’s penalty and a goal from the former Chelsea youngster Omari Hutchinson made it one point from three festive fixtures, hopes of a surprise Premier League title tilt appear to be at an end. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: 'Our best achievement' - Ipswich enjoy historic home win
arts.sum: Forwards Liam Delap and Omari Hutchinson weren't born the last time Ipswich Town won a home match in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: McKenna: Victory over Chelsea a 'special night' for Ipswich
arts.sum: Goals in either half from Liam Delap and former Chelsea winger Omari Hutchinson earned Ipswich a maiden home win since promotion at the 10th attempt and a first at Portman Road in the Premier League since 2002. First home win in the Premier League at Portman Road for 22 years and to do it against Chelsea in the manner we did was fantastic, McKenna told Sky Sports after the match.

arts.ttl: Enzo Maresca admits Chelsea a long way from competing with Premier League’s best
arts.sum: Liam Delap and Omari Hutchinson scored to earn Ipswich victory.

arts.ttl: Enzo Maresca reveals why Chelsea can be 'satisfied' despite Ipswich loss as dip in form proves point
arts.sum: Chelsea frustrated on a difficult night at Portman Road

arts.ttl: 'One of the best nights' - McKenna on Ipswich beating Chelsea
arts.sum: Ipswich Town manager Kieran McKenna says the 2-0 win against Chelsea was "one of the best nights" as the team earned their first home win of the Premier League season.

arts.ttl: Chelsea not focused on title race - Maresca
arts.sum: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca says his side are "not focused" on the title race following a 2-0 defeat by Ipswich Town in the Premier League.
